Campus Safety
Greek Life
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

The campus is pretty much safe seeing as how you have to go past the security booth before entering the main campus. Most freshman stay across the street in their designated dorms, which are gated and has its own little security booth. Only those freshman have key access to the gates.
The Greeks keep campus alive and fun. Their mini performances during gym parties get the whole school involved. The students love cheering on the fraternities and sororities.
There is: tennis, volleyball, track & field, basketball, football, modeling troupes, a cheerleading squad, and so much more.
JCSU is great for students who like a small campus with small classes, where everbody knows everybody.
On designated Thursdays, at 10:10 pm, campus clubs and organizations make-up short performances for all students to get an insight on what they are all about.

Johnson C. Smith University is a private institute so there is no in-state/out-of-state tuition; everyone pays the same amount for tuition. Teachers are so involved in the students' academic progress, as well as satisfying graduation requirements, such as community service projects.

Via bus, there's several malls, movies, and restaurants. If you have a car though, there's so much more. Clubs, bowling, skating, facilities for outdoor activities (mountain climbing, whitewater rafting, etc.), museums and much more!
Food could use a little improvement but still good nonetheless.
Dorms are nice and clean. Great housekeeping staff.
Nice, small classrooms. You have the ability to get to know your professors and vice versa. You can actually learn and engage in the lessons versus taking endless notes in a class of 400 students.

Manage your time well. Do not get so involved with the party life that you forget why you're attending the school in the first place. Get to know your professors, as well as your peers, because you'll need someone's help before you graduate. Don't forget to enjoy your college career and still try to have fun!
A wonderful school with small class proportions. Great sense of community there. Located in Charlotte, the Queen City.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Brittne from Copley, OH 05/16/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 3 of 43 Categories Comments Great for these types of students If you wanna have fun and get a great education this is the best institution for you! Tips for prospective students Get to know your professors and administration. It will make coming to Smith easier. Bang for the buck For what we pay to attend JCSU I expect more, but we are growing and building to make JCSU the best HBCU in the south. Am enjoying being here I have met some really terrific people who I wouldn't trade in for the world!!!!!!! Am learning a lot I am learning so much at Johnson C. Smith University. Everyday
